isis.stitle: CAB: 5000i AND 9000i CONVENTIONAL - INSTALL - TWO PIECE ENCAPSULATED WINDSHIELD

svcprocinfo.para: There are two types of urethane adhesive that may be used to install encapsulated windshields on the vehicles covered in this service manual.

It is recommended to use the two part U216 urethane adhesive that comes in the Essex® windshield installation kit (Figure 123) . The use of this urethane adhesive allows for a 30 minute drive away time for the customer.

An optional one part U400HV urethane adhesive may be used when installing encapsulated windshields, but the cure time is based on time, temperature and humidity and the cure table for U400HV urethane adhesive. This requires a much longer drive away time for the customer.

svcsubproc.title: Install Two Piece Encapsulated Windshield using Two Part U216 Urethane Adhesive (adhesive A and curative B)
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 4 for Items in parentheses.
The 5000 i Series and 9000 i Series vehicles come standard with a one piece encapsulated windshield (Item 1). A two piece encapsulated windshield (Item 2) is available as an option.

important.para: To install a two piece encapsulated windshield you will need to have the INTERNATIONAL® Bonded Windshield Tool Kit ZTSE4470. This kit has a tool box that includes the tools required to remove and install bonded windshields. To order, call toll free in U. S. and Canada 1-800-520-2584 or Fax 1-800-578-7375. NOTE - The INTERNATIONAL® Bonded Windshield Tool Kit ZTSE4470 is no longer available through the INTERNATIONAL® tool supplier. For materials that are available contact INTERNATIONAL® service parts.

svcsubproc.para: To install a two piece encapsulated windshield, you will also need the Essex® windshield installation kit (Figure 123) . One Essex® windshield installation kit will be needed for each half of the windshield if both halves are being replaced at the same time. The kit includes:

item.para: U216 adhesive (two tubes, adhesive A and curative B)

svcsubproc.para: These materials must be used on or before expiration date marked on container. U413 windshield Fence Primer, U401 windshield Glass Prep and U402 windshield Glass Primer have a 6 month shelf life. U216 Urethane adhesive A and Curative B tubes have a 9 month shelf life.
In addition to the items supplied in the Essex® windshield installation kit (Figure 123) , you will need the following materials:
In addition to the items supplied in the kit listed above, you will need the following materials:

item.para: Applicator nozzles from Essex® to puncture U216 adhesive (two tubes, adhesive A and curative B)

note.para: For the windshield, use only laminated safety glass (AS-1 per ANSI Z26.1-Latest revision) and International TMS-9522 (SAE J1203).

warning.para: To avoid personal injury, wear protective work gloves when handling the windshield. Also wear appropriate protective gloves when using any of the Betaseal system chemicals from the Essex® windshield installation kit.

caution.para: Never try to use any remaining U216 urethane adhesive left over after installing first windshield half when installing both windshield halves at the same time. Due to the quick cure time of U216 urethane adhesive, the adhesive will have started curing by the time you are ready to apply it to the other windshield half. You must use a second Essex® windshield installation kit (Figure 123) when installing the second windshield half.

note.para: Before installing new windshield, wipe off any water remaining around windshield fence and surrounding cab area with a lint free cloth.

step1.para: Dry fit new windshield on vehicle to make sure the windshield fits windshield opening properly before applying U216 adhesive. Once the windshield is positioned properly in the windshield opening place a piece of tape as a reference mark across the center upper portion of windshield and cab. Use a utility knife and cut the tape between the cab and windshield.
Remove new windshield from vehicle and place it on a suitable padded work stand to prepare it for installation.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 124 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove urethane adhesive (Item 1) from windshield fence (Item 2) around windshield opening with a gasket chisel (Item 3). A thin layer of old urethane adhesive of 2 to 3 mm thick (Item 4) may be left on windshield fence. Try to keep a consistent thickness of old urethane adhesive around the perimeter of the windshield fence.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 125 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Clean dirt and any water left from spraying around windshield during removal off windshield fence (Item 1) with a brush or clean, lint free cloth (Item 2) before installing new windshield.

step1.para: Take U413 windshield fence primer (Item 1, Figure 123) from Essex® windshield installation kit. Shake U413 windshield fence primer (Item 1) for at least one minute. Remove cover (Item 2) from container.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 127 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Apply U413 windshield fence primer (Item 1) with a clean dry applicator (Item 2) to cover scratches and bare metal on windshield fence (Item 3). DO NOT apply U413 windshield fence primer over old urethane adhesive left on windshield fence.
Allow U413 windshield fence primer to dry for 6 to 10 minutes minimum after application.
With new windshield on a padded stand and prepare windshield for installation as follows:

Using a razor blade if necessary and plastic scrubbing pad, remove any windshield encapsulation flash from bonding surface of new windshield. Clean new windshield thoroughly with Essex® glass cleaner GC800 (Figure 144). Dry thoroughly with paper towels. Make sure windshield is completely clean and dry before proceeding.

figure.caption: Figure 144. Cleaning Windshield for U401 Windshield Glass Prep, U402 Windshield Glass Primer and U216 Adhesive Application

note.para: Read completely through step 11 below to ensure the correct application and removal of the windshield glass prep U401.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 145 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Apply U401 windshield glass prep (Item 1) with a clean, dry applicator (Item 2) to bonding surface only on new windshield (Item 3). If applied to clear glass surface, glass will haze. Immediately wipe windshield glass prep off by following eight to ten inches behind the applicator with a white or brown paper towel. DO NOT use a cloth shop towel. After completing first application of windshield glass prep, repeat windshield glass prep application and removal process. This is a clear liquid.

figure.caption: Figure 145. Application of U401 Windshield Glass Prep to Windshield

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 126 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Once U401 windshield glass prep has been applied and wiped off new windshield, take U402 windshield glass primer (Item 3, Figure 123) from Essex® windshield installation kit. Shake U402 windshield glass primer (Item 1) for at least one minute. Remove cover (Item 2) from container.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 146 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Apply U402 windshield glass primer (Item 1) with a clean, dry applicator (Item 2) to bonding surface on new windshield (Item 3).

figure.caption: Figure 146. Application of U402 Windshield Glass Primer to Windshield

step1.para: Allow U402 windshield glass primer to dry to a tack free condition for 6 to 10 minutes minimum after application.

caution.para: Once the windshield has been primed, ensure there is no contact with bonding surface as oil from skin will affect bonding performance. If the windshield is not bonded properly the cab strength and safety would be compromised. If contact with bonding surface has occurred, repeat the cleaning process and reapply U402 windshield glass primer and allow it to dry for 6 to 10 minutes before applying U216 adhesive.

step1.para: Remove Essex® U216 adhesive (two tubes, adhesive A and curative B), application mixing head and applicator nozzle (Items 4 thru 7, Figure 123) from Essex® windshield installation kit.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 131 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Using the pull tab or a screwdriver (Item 1) if pull tab not supplied, pry out bottom cover (Item 2) from both adhesive A and curative B adhesive tubes (Item 3).

step1.para: Use one applicator nozzle (Item 1) supplied separately by Essex® to puncture adhesive A tube (Item 2). Use the other applicator nozzle (Item 1) supplied separately by Essex® to puncture curative B tube (Item 2). DO NOT use the same applicator nozzle to puncture both tubes; this keeps from contaminating the other tube before installing application mixing head (Item 6, Figure 123) . Be sure to push applicator nozzle all the way in to ensure adhesive tubes are fully opened.
Once both adhesive A and curative B adhesive tubes (Item 2) have been prepared for use, remove application mixing head (Item 6, Figure 123) from Essex® windshield installation kit.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 133 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install both adhesive A and curative B adhesive tubes (Item 1) on application mixing head (Item 2).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 134 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Once both adhesive A and curative B adhesive tubes (Item 1) are installed on application mixing head (Item 2), remove applicator nozzle (Item 7, Figure 123) from Essex® windshield installation kit. Install applicator nozzle (Item 3) on application mixing head (Item 2). Cut tab (Item 4) off applicator nozzle. Measure and mark a 3/8 inch wide by 5/8 inch long with a 1/8 inch wide dimension at the base of the new notch (Item 5) to replace the current V-notch on the applicator nozzle. Use a utility knife and cut out new notch to allow for proper adhesive application.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 135 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Before loading adhesive tubes with application mixing head and applicator nozzle (Item 1) into betagun (Item 2), pull trigger and run plungers (Item 3) all the way back to allow for adhesive tubes to be loaded. Open front cover (Item 4) on betagun and install adhesive tubes with application mixing head and applicator nozzle into betagun.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 136 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once adhesive tubes with application mixing head and applicator nozzle (Item 1) have been installed into betagun (Item 2), close front cover (Item 3). Run plungers (Item 4) forward on betagun until plungers are in position to apply adhesive. Stop when adhesive reaches applicator nozzle.

note.para: When replacing both passenger and driver side windshields the passenger side windshield should be installed first, then install driver side windshield. If passenger side windshield only is being replaced, there is a tab which is part of the encapsulation rubber trim at the top of the driver side windshield that must be flipped out from behind the passenger side windshield after installation. This encapsulation rubber trim tab has a beveled edge that lays over and matches the beveled edge of the encapsulation rubber trim on the passenger side windshield.
Application of adhesive bead shall be 0 to 2 mm from encapsulation edge and be at least 5/8 to 3/4 inch (15 to 20 mm) high and 3/8 to 1/2 inch (8 to 12 mm) wide maximum.

important.para: If U216 two part adhesive runs out before getting all the way around the windshield, it is acceptable to fill in the gap left (6 inches or less) with U400HV one part urethane adhesive using a standard cocking gun. It is recommended that because of the short time frame in which to install the windshield to have a tube of U400HV one part urethane adhesive loaded into a cocking gun and ready to use so the time will not run out to get the windshield installed onto the vehicle.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 147 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Holding betagun (Item 1) and applicator nozzle (Item 2) as close to a 90 degree angle as possible and starting at the International logo on lower driver side corner, pull trigger to apply a uniform bead of adhesive (Item 3) going across the bottom all the way around windshield. The harder you pull the trigger the faster the adhesive will extrude. Use this variable speed control to slow down as you apply adhesive around the corners. Overlap adhesive at the seam slightly, and use a plastic or wood tongue depressor (Item 4) to smooth or even out adhesive as required before installing windshield.

figure.caption: Figure 147. Using Betagun to Apply Adhesive

step1.para: Once adhesive has been applied on windshield it MUST be installed within 5 to 7 minutes maximum. Adhesive starts curing immediately and will not provide an adequate bond if not installed within the 5 to 7 minute time frame.
Carry windshield to vehicle and install as follows, driver side windshield shown (Figure 148).

important.para: The quick curing time of U216 two part urethane adhesive allows the vehicle to be driven 30 minutes after completing windshield installation. If the vehicle is equipped with AIR BAGS, the U216 two part urethane adhesive should be allowed to cure for 60 minutes before driving. Even if U400HV one part urethane adhesive has to be used to fill in a gap of 6 inches or less during the application of U216 two part urethane adhesive the cure time before the vehicle can be driven will be the same as above. If more than 6 inches of U400HV one part urethane adhesive is used, you will need to use the area on the Form Bonded Windshield Replacement Report (Figure 183) to record Time, Temperature and Humidity and follow the cure table for U400HV.

step1.para: Position driver side A pillar trim panel (Item 2) in place inside cab and install four torx self-drilling screws (Item 3). Reinstall four fastener covers (Item 1) on fasteners of A pillar trim panel.
Before installing passenger side A pillar (Item 5), install passenger side window demist duct with rubber tube (Item 8) in place and install two torx self-drilling screws (Item 7) to secure it.

Use a blunt tip screwdriver to pry the side cab trim panel out slightly to position the bottom of the passenger side A pillar trim panel (Item 5) in place behind it. Note that the bottom torx self-drilling screw (Item 6) goes through the inner side cab trim panel and passenger side A pillar trim panel. Position passenger side A pillar in place inside cab and install three torx self-drilling screws (Item 6) securing it to the cab. Reinstall fastener covers (Item 4) on two upper fasteners only on passenger side A pillar trim panel.

Once both defroster duct cover panels (Item 2, Figure 7) , driver side A pillar trim panel (Item 2) and passenger side A pillar trim panel (Item 5) have been reinstalled inside the cab, turn the blower onto high speed to check that the defroster works properly and to blow out any debris that may have fallen into the ducts while removing the windshield. If any debris came out, wipe it away.

Reinstall windshield wiper arms and blades. Refer to
WINDSHIELD WIPER ARM AND BLADE ASSEMBLY
, Install Windshield Wiper Arm and Blade Assembly.
Test operation of windshield wipers and washer, then clean windshield and surrounding area.
Close hood and latch hood on both sides.

important.para: To allow for the correct curing time of U400HV one part urethane adhesive, you will need to use the area on the Form Bonded Windshield Replacement Report (Figure 183) to record Time, Temperature and Humidity and follow the cure table for U400HV.
